intro: Gonzalea lygistum, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, adding to its ornamental appeal.
